description: Step-by-step outline of a two-rakʿah prayer.  Repeat steps 4-9 for each additional rakʿah; see step 11 for Qunūt in Fajr.

steps.description: Form the specific intention in the heart for the prayer about to be performed.
Raise both hands to shoulder/ear level with palms facing Qiblah, say the opening takbīr, then place the right hand over the left on the upper chest.

steps.arabic: دعاء الاستفتاح، أعوذ بالله، بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم، الفاتحة، سورة
steps.transliteration: Duʿāʾ al-istiftāḥ, Taʿawwudh, Basmala, Sūrat al-Fātiḥah, another sūrah
steps.description: Recite the opening supplication silently, Taʿawwudh, then Basmala aloud in audible prayers; recite al-Fātiḥah and another sūrah in the first two rakʿahs.
Say “Allāhu Akbar”, raise the hands again to shoulder level, then bow into rukūʿ.
Back straight, hands grasping knees; recite the tasbīḥ three times.

steps.arabic: سمع الله لمن حمده ربنا ولك الحمد
steps.transliteration: Samiʿa Allāhu liman ḥamidah, Rabbanā laka l-ḥamd
steps.description: Rise fully upright while raising the hands a third time, then recite the tasmiʿ and taḥmīd.
Prostrate on seven points; repeat the tasbīḥ three times.
Sit in iftirāsh (left foot flattened, right foot upright) for a brief pause.
Perform the second sajdah exactly like the first.
Say “Allāhu Akbar”, stand for the second rakʿah while raising the hands a fourth time.
In Fajr only: after rising from rukūʿ in the 2nd rakʿah, recite Qunūt aloud while standing.
Sit and recite the tashahhud; raise the index finger at “illā Allāh” and keep it raised until the end of the supplication.
For 3- or 4-rakʿah prayers, stand for the remaining rakʿahs; in these, recite only al-Fātiḥah (no additional sūrah).

steps.arabic: اللهم صل على محمد وعلى آل محمد...
steps.description: In the last sitting (tawarruk), repeat the tashahhud, add Ṣalawāt Ibrāhīmiyyah and any closing duʿāʾ.
Conclude with two taslīms: turn the head right, pause briefly, then left.

notes: Hands are raised at four junctures (entering prayer, before and after rukūʿ, and when rising for the third rakʿah).  Basmala is recited aloud in audible prayers.  Qunūt is a strong sunna in the second rakʿah of Fajr.
